heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 11.8mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 5th from our records) and resulted in 7.28mm of total rain in 2.1 hours.  27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: When lightning struck on 13 May 2025, its position was recorded at just 4.97 miles away, the closest on record.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 07 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (184°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 50.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 17%) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.4 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 1331 m), light levels (up 9173 lux), and rainfall (up 0.4 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 13064 lux), cloud levels (up 1435 m), feels like temperature (up 5.1°C), and outside temperature (up 3.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1330.5m lower than yesterday, 1132.0m lower than the past week, 1434.5m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 911m and a peak of 4090m, averaging 945.1m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

dew point temperature.description:
Today’s average dew point temperature is 3.6°C higher than yesterday, 1.0°C higher than the past week, 0.1°C lower than the past month.

The dew point temperatures yesterday fell between 1.5°C minimum and 13.6°C maximum, with an average of 12.3°C; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 11.3°C and 12.4°C.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air moisture should feel ok and little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
